subject: RE: [junit] help please
msgSnippet: In the name of ALLAH many thanks for you Kent.Can you explain your point of view about how the program or the project is senior one,and can you give me some
messageBody:
In the name of ALLAH
many thanks for you Kent.Can you explain your point of view about how the program or the project is senior one,and can you give me some examples about the most important features that we must first implement them and other features that is plus.
Note:we work in the project all the year not half of the year(from now until 7/2006).
please reply me as soon as you can
Ahmed Fouad.


Kent Beck <kentb@...> wrote:
Ahmed,

Your test framework/coverage tool sounds like it is the right size for a
senior project. Two of my books have information that might be helpful to
you. "Test-Driven Development: By Example" shows an example of writing a
testing framework. "JUnit Pocket Guide" talks about the patterns of using a
testing framework like JUnit. It seems to me that the biggest problem in
implementing such a tool is deciding what subset of features you are going
to focus on. Both testing frameworks and coverage tools can contain many
more features than you are likely to get implemented in half a year. I would
write a little tool that combines minimal testing and coverage features,
make sure it works on itself (you are studying computer science after all),
and then add features one at a time.

Sincerely yours,

Kent Beck
Three Rivers Institute

> -----Original Message-----
> From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On

> out this project?
> what are the problems to implement this project?
> Note:we are 5 members and work with JAVA.
> please reply me soon and also send your comments about any
> questions that I have not asked.
